If I search something in Perplexity, then with each search, around 2 MB of my data gets used up, whereas if I do a Google search, less than 100 KB of my data used. This happens because if I search something in Perplexity, then the search result is displayed along with the image. Because of that, so much data gets consumed. So, if I do 50 searches a day, then my 100 MB data will get used up just like that. I would like to say to use the data saving mode and the mode of not showing images.

Perplexity is (or seems to be) a combination of an LLM, AI, and multiple chatbots, so it's usually dead on with its responses to pretty much any prompt. Takes Chat GPT to a whole new level. I have both and use Perplexity far more often for general purposes (however, Chat GPT can be customized.) I only gave Perplexity 4 stars because there's always room for improvement, but if they offered percentages I would have given it 4.99 out of 5.00 for a rating.

I like Perplexity, due to it being a perfect replacement for Google (also basically any search engine) and any AI model. Primarily use it for tech questions and troubleshooting, which the model does a good job with. You can ask Perplexity Â«how to...Â» with 48 sentences if you wish, rather than try to phrase your problem in three words for Google so it can find something close enough. The only thing that's missing to me is scroll to the bottom button in already existing chats.
